events.name: IBM | Spark Signature Moment Singapore Event
events.description: IBM is placing its biggest bet on open source innovation since we led the adoption of Linux through hundreds of business solutions. We are announcing our commitment to Apache Spark, an in-memory compute engine that delivers eye-opening speed and flexibility to data scientists and developers working with big data at scale. In fact, we are bringing the speed, agility and power of Spark into our Analytics Platform to make sure we're meeting the emerging needs of data-driven enterprises. After our initial launch we will be hosting a regional Spark Signature Moment Event in Singapore on Thursday July 2, 2015 Join Us for an Update & Lunch to Learn About IBM’s Commitment to Open Source & Spark Innovation Agenda: Reception and introductions by IBM regional Executive Highlights from IBM Signature Moment Round Table in San Francisco Presentation: o The use cases for Big Data platform and the benefits of Apache Spark o IBM’s innovations for Apache Spark, hybrid architecture o Open Data Platform (ODP) o IBM’s Analytics Platform for Apache Spark Lunch Check us out at: ibm.co/ibmspark RSVP by June 25th – LIMITED SEATING
events.location: IBM Client Centre, No.6 Tampines Industrial Ave 5 ,Singaore 528760, Singapore

events.name: Thursday 2nd July
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along!

events.name: Hackathon@SG Bluemix Workshop (IOT, Mobile and SoftLayer)
events.description: IBM Bluemix is a Platform-as-a-Service (Paas) that supports several programming languages and services as well as integrated DevOps to build, run, deploy and manage applications on the cloud. This session will cover the following: - Smart Nation intro by IDA - Overview of IBM Cloud (Bluemix/SL) - IBM IOT Foundation - Build Mobile App with Bluemix - SoftLayer and your hosting/computational requirements - Wrap up *Bring your own laptop Register here for your Bluemix account.
events.location: SMU School of Economics, Seminar Room 2.6, 90 Stamford Road, 178903, Singapore

events.name: July/2015 - Open Space (Tools)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Farid Baharuddin from WPH Open Space Theme: Tools Farid: This can be tools to help development and management agile projects, how they are good or how in general they are bad, tools for "no-estimates", books or whatever helps us improve productivity or ourselves. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) . Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Someone from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he/she will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: How to get started with Elixir?
events.description: Get a first glance of the language. Explore the core concepts of Elixir and Erlang. Agenda 19:00 - 19:30 Get together, take a bite and cheer 19:30 - 20:00 What is Elixir? Code examples? 20:00 - 20:15 Break 20:15 - 20:45 What is Elixir? Code examples (cont.) 20:45 - 21:00 Lessons learned, closing result = meet |> ignite |> have a good time

events.name: Hack and Tell
events.description: Show and tell for hackers. Five minute demos, each followed by 5 minutes of Q&A.
